pullRequest.body:
This PR attempts to make `mono_comp` and `epi_comp` instances.

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [c4e6cd1707](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16530/commits/c4e6cd170723bab64c8a719d6921b1d1ba2b0f3f)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ cancel_epi_assoc_iff`
`+ cancel_mono_assoc_iff`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/e7aea54d-336e-4dd1-9f97-0aab981e3841) for commit 4c510218130eca0e1d207a805df270175c00d639.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/53fb311b-23a3-48a1-9bac-7620ec296bed/to/e7aea54d-336e-4dd1-9f97-0aab981e3841) against commit fd6c31182d6b88c28e04d9bee8df7e6a54e279e4.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10750062695/job/29815753015)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10750062695/job/29815753156)
This looks like it shouldn't be its own lemma, and should be made as some reassoc where needed?
`reassoc` will not produce a lemma of this form, it would produce one where `f = g` implies `f ≫ h ≫ j = g ≫ h ≫ j` for any `j`, which is not really useful. Maybe I should change the name?
Right, I think this situation is exactly what `reassoc_of` is for; Matthew's suggestion is precisely what I had in mind

Ohh right, yeah that should probably work. However, then the next problem is that `reassoc` imports this file, so I can't use it here. But maybe I should just prove this directly in the proof that requires it below?

Ah, that is indeed a convincing problem! I think proving it directly is a better option - this lemma isn't going to be used outside this file but since you need something like it below, probably you can get away with that. If this turns out to be prohibitively longer, however, you could alternatively make it private.
I'm gonna guess that this still needs to be an instance since instance resolution can't look through the definition otherwise. I might be wrong though...

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Category/Basic): make `mono_comp` and `epi_comp` instances and golf proofs
